channel.title: Need A Little Help Please
channel.description:
I am trying to wrap my head around all of this. I am a noob to Java but not to programming. I know a few programming concepts buy playing around with C# a couple years ago. Here are my questions:
1. What do I need to start to program and play a RS2 clone but not have anyone else play on it yet? 2. What do you suggest as the best (or safest) programs and/or tools that I need? 3. Other than the Sun Java web site, are there any other good sites to visit for tutorials/ebooks on Java?
Thanks in advance. If this in the wrong place, could a mod either move it or kill it please.

item.title: Need A Little Help Please
item.dc:creator: @DragoonDex DragoonDex
item.description:
@DragoonDex wrote:

Thanks for replying Rog3r. I was thinking about using Eclipse as my IDE, I just donâ€™t know how good it is for a noob. Do I need to follow the instructions for starting a private server just to program and check out what I have programmed by playing or can I just download a source?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 02, 2008, 10:30:32 am[/size][hr]Just to clairify: Do I need any thing more than an IDE(or Notepad++) and a source to play and program a RS clone?

Read full topic

item.title: Need A Little Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

What program?

Just use notepad or any IDE.
Without doing anything, no one can play on it until you portforward it.

I suggest using Notepadd ++ or IntelliJ

If you want to learn more, just search on Google and you should find it.

Read full topic

item.title: Need A Little Help Please
item.dc:creator: @DragoonDex DragoonDex
item.description:

I am trying to wrap my head around all of this. I am a noob to Java but not to programming. I know a few programming concepts buy playing around with C# a couple years ago. Here are my questions:
